intro: Stenocalyx pitanga var. nana, commonly known as dwarf pitanga, is a compact shrub native to Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and clusters of fragrant white flowers. The plant produces small, orange-red berries that are edible and often used in local cuisine. It thrives in tropical climates and requires well-drained soil and partial shade. Due to its ornamental value and unique fruit, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
